title: Qantas Frequent Flyer Typeface
content:
Hi, The Q symbol has probably been customised from the main typeface.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204127im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Qantas_6256.JPG)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204127im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Qantas%20Frequent%20Flyer_5542.jpg)

Font: 

 Flama Condensed 

Solved By: 

 [R](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204127/http:/typophile.com/user/8968 "View user profile.")
author: RBM

comments.content:
Knowing Qantas, this is likely to be a custom font. It is a very close match for [Alternate Gothic No. 3](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204127/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/alternate-gothic-lt/) in terms of character shapes, widths etc. — though Alternate Gothic is quite heavy and doesn't have the straight tail on the /Q/.

Qantas have rebranded recently. You may be interested in seeing their current corporate style book, [available here](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204127/http:/www.qantas.com.au/guidelines/resources/Qantas_Masterbrand_Guidelines_June_2013.pdf).
Looks like Mario Feliciano’s [Flama Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204127/http:/vllg.com/feliciano/flama-condensed) to me.

Thanks again for your help osamu.

R - you've got it! Thanks.
